poem:
**Reappearance**  

In the shadows of a vanished era,  
where whispers of charcoal and canvas persist,  
Picasso brushes flowered mystery  
across time, unveiling Dora once more.  
A hat blooms over history's quiet swirl,  
capturing the forgotten echo  
of eyes softened by war's heavy brush,  
found again in the quiet auction room.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Picasso painting not seen for 80 years unveiled by Paris auction house A newly discovered painting by Pablo Picasso of the French photographer and painter Dora Maar completed during the German occupation of Paris that has not been seen for 80 years, has been unveiled. The work, Bust of a Woman in a Flowery Hat (Dora Maar), was finished towards the end of the couple’s turbulent nine-year relationship and shows Maar in a softer, more". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
